Control Number and Name: A.9.4 Intended use of the AI system
Instruction: Document the AI system's intended use and limitations.

Control Number and Name: A.6.2.2: AI system requirements and specification
Instruction: Specify and document all requirements for new AI systems or for material enhancements to existing systems.

Control Number and Name:
A.5.4 Assessing AI system impact on individuals or groups of individuals
A.5.5 Assessing societal impacts of AI systems
Instruction: Determine if the AI system is prohibited

Control Number and Name: A.5.2 AI system impact assessment process
Instruction: The AI System Requester must complete the "AI System Significance Questionnaire" to determine the system's potential impact and sensitivity. This assessment serves as a critical filter to ascertain whether the AI system requires a Full AI System Risk Assessment or a Light Touch AI System Risk Assessment. Based on the questionnaire's outcome:

Control Number and Name:
A.5.2 AI system impact assessment process
A.5.3 Documentation of AI system impact assessments
Instruction: Full AI System Risk Assessment: If the AI system is determined to be "Significant" (as per the significance determination logic in the questionnaire), conduct a Full AI System Risk Assessment to assess the potential consequences for individuals or groups of individuals, or both, and societies that can result from the AI system throughout its life cycle. And define controls to treat them.

Control Number and Name:
A.5.4 Assessing AI system impact on individuals or groups of individuals
A.5.5 Assessing societal impacts of AI systems
Instruction: Evaluate the potential consequences for individuals or groups of individuals, or both, and societies that can result from the AI system.

Control Number and Name:
A.5.2 AI system impact assessment process
A.5.3 Documentation of AI system impact assessments
Instruction: Light Touch AI System Risk Assessment: If the AI system is determined to be "Not Significant", proceed to conduct a Light Touch AI System Risk Assessment, assess the potential consequences for individuals or groups of individuals, or both, and societies that can result from the AI system throughout its life cycle. And define controls to treat them.
Approve Reject request

Control Number and Name:
A.4.2 Resource documentation
A.4.3 Data resources
A.4.4 Tooling resources
A.4.5 System and computing resources
Instruction: Define the complete inventory of all required resources.

Control Number and Name:
A.8.2 System documentation and information for users
A.8.5 Information for interested parties
A.8.3 External reporting
A.8.4 Communication of incidents
Instruction: Define and document the information, reporting, and incident communication plan for all internal and external interested parties.

Control Number and Name:
A.7.3 Acquisition of data
A.7.4 Quality of data
A.7.5 Data provenance
Instruction: For each Data Resource identified in the AI System Inventory, define the strategy, criteria, and process for acquiring data, including its sources and any legal or ethical constraints.

Control Number and Name:
A.9.3 Objectives for responsible use of AI system
A.9.2 Processes for responsible use of AI systems
A.3.2 AI roles and responsibilities
Instruction: Document objectives to guide the responsible use AI systems, and complete the RACI.

Control Number and Name:
A.6.1.2 Objectives for responsible development of AI system
A.3.2 AI roles and responsibilities
Instruction: Document objectives to guide the responsible development AI systems, and complete the RACI.

Control Number and Name:
A.10.2 Allocating responsibilities
A.10.3 Suppliers
A.10.4 Customers
Instruction: Establish a process to manage all stakeholder relationships, ensuring that responsibilities are clearly allocated, supplier activities align with internal AI policies, and customer needs are fully considered.

Control Number and Name: A.6.2.3: AI system design and development
Instruction: Document how requirements from AI System Requirements Specification have been translated into system design.

Control Number and Name:
A.4.2 Resource documentation
A.4.3 Data resources
A.4.4 Tooling resources
A.4.5 System and computing resources
A.4.6 Human resources
Instruction: Update the AI Resource Inventory to reflect the AI Design & Development, if required.

Control Number and Name: A.6.1.2 Objectives for responsible development of AI system
Instruction: Formally hand over the Objectives for AI development to the devlopment team, and ensure they understand the RACI and complete their responsibilites.
Address the risks identified in the Impact Assessment, if they are above tolerance.
Develop a comprehensive deployment plan. Prior to go-live, verify and sign-off that all resource, documentation, and operational requirements have been successfully met.

Control Number and Name:
A.4.2 Resource documentation
A.4.3 Data resources
A.4.4 Tooling resources
A.4.5 System and computing resources
Instruction: Confirm that all AI system resources (documentation, data, tooling, computing, and human) are correctly configured and functioning in the production environment as per the deployment plan.

Template.text: Resource Documentation Checklist, Data Access Validation Record, Tooling Readiness Checklist, System Infrastructure Checklist

Instruction: In the "Tested" column, confirm that the measures and evidence for each development objective have been tested to ensure the AI system's performance, functionality, and compliance.

Control Number and Name:
A.4.2 Resource documentation
A.4.3 Data resources
A.4.4 Tooling resources
A.4.5 System and computing resources
A.4.6 Human resources
Instruction: Verify that all testing activities are performed using only the approved and documented resources (data, tools, hardware) and personnel, all within the specified, secure computing environment to ensure repeatable and consistent results.

Control Number and Name:
A.7.4 Quality of data
A.7.5 Data provenance
Instruction:
Confirm that all datasets:
a) are high quality, complete, and representative
b) have meet the Data Quality Requirements
c) comply with the Data Preparation Plan. 
d) verify the provenance of this data to ensure it is entirely independent of the training data.

Control Number and Name: A.6.2.3: AI system design and development
Instruction: Verify that the requirements from AI System Requirements Specification have been translated into system design.

Control Number and Name: A.9.4 Intended use of the AI system
Instruction: Verify that the system design enforce oonly the intended use of the AI System.

Validate that all user and system documentation is accurate and reflects the tested behavior. Ensure all V&V tasks, including those by third-party suppliers, are performed in alignment with the documented responsibility matrix (RACI).

Control Number and Name:
A.8.2 System documentation and information for users
A.8.5 Information for interested parties
A.8.3 External reporting
A.8.4 Communication of incidents
Instruction: Before go-live, publish final user documentation and distribute tailored information packages to all internal and external stakeholders, clearly communicating the system's intended use and limitations.
Before go-live, brief all relevant teams on the responsible use of the AI system. Communicate the systemâ€™s intended purpose, capabilities, and known limitations.

Control Number and Name:
A.10.2 Allocating responsibilities
A.10.3 Suppliers
A.10.4 Customers
Instruction: Before go-live, formally hand over the AI system to the live operations team, with clearly defined customer and supplier expectations.

Control Number and Name:
A.10.2 Allocating responsibilities
A.10.3 Suppliers
A.10.4 Customers
Instruction: Before go-live, formally distribute the Objectives for of AI use to guide the responsible use AI systems.

Establish and maintain the overall plan for system operation, ensure that Operational Duties RACI has been completed in full. Actively enforce governance processes and ensure all parties adhere to their documented responsibilities.

Control Number and Name: A.4.x
Instruction: Continuously monitor the health, performance, and cost of all production resources, including infrastructure, data sources, and software tools. Ensure designated teams are actively maintaining the system and applying necessary updates.

Implement continuous monitoring to track data quality, detect drift, and log data provenance for critical decisions. Actively monitor the AI model's performance against its responsible AI objectives (e.g., fairness, bias) and check for signs of misuse.

Execute the predefined incident communication process for any significant system failure or breach. Manage all required external reporting and ensure all user-facing documentation is continuously updated to reflect system changes.

Establish a process to feed operational data and customer feedback back into the development cycle for future enhancements. Continuously monitor supplier performance to manage risks and ensure service quality.
